n8n.name: n8n Workflow Automation
n8n.description: Access to n8n workflows, automation capabilities, and workflow execution
when_to_use: Need to automate repetitive tasks or processes
Build data pipelines or ETL workflows
example_queries: What workflows are available for customer onboarding?
Show me workflows that integrate with Slack and email
What are the best practices for error handling in n8n?
How can I schedule a workflow to run daily?
Show me templates for data synchronization

agent_instructions.activation: When a user's request involves automation, integration between services, scheduled tasks, or workflow orchestration, consider using the n8n MCP server to explore available solutions.
agent_instructions.usage: Query n8n to understand automation capabilities, available integrations, and existing workflows. Use this information to inform your technical approach and identify automation opportunities.
agent_instructions.integration: When proposing solutions that involve automation, reference n8n capabilities in the 'Technical Considerations' or 'Proposed Solution' sections. Highlight how n8n can reduce manual effort and improve efficiency.
best_practices: Always check if existing workflows can be reused or adapted
Consider n8n for connecting disparate systems without custom code
Recommend n8n when multiple API integrations are needed
Highlight cost savings from automation in your proposals
Mention n8n's visual workflow builder for non-technical users

how_to_use.for_agents: When proposing solutions that involve automation, data integration, or connecting multiple services, query the n8n MCP server to understand what's possible. n8n can often replace custom integration code with visual workflows.
how_to_use.for_humans: This configuration enables agents to access your n8n instance and understand available automation capabilities. Ensure your n8n server is running and the MCP server is properly configured in your VS Code or Copilot settings.
setup_instructions: Ensure n8n is installed and running (self-hosted or cloud)
Install the n8n MCP server: npm install -g n8n-mcp
Set environment variables: N8N_API_URL and N8N_API_KEY
Configure the MCP server in your VS Code/Copilot settings

N8N_API_KEY.description: Your n8n API key for authentication
N8N_API_KEY.note: Generate this from your n8n instance Settings > API Keys

environment_variables.N8N_API_URL: Your n8n instance URL (e.g., https://your-n8n.com or http://localhost:5678)
environment_variables.N8N_API_KEY: Your n8n API key for authentication

troubleshooting.connection_failed: Verify N8N_API_URL is correct and n8n is running
troubleshooting.authentication_error: Check that N8N_API_KEY is valid and has proper permissions
troubleshooting.no_workflows_found: Ensure you have created at least one workflow in n8n
troubleshooting.execution_timeout: Check workflow complexity and server resources
